instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message:
Nothing visible on board. Very small area looks like may have been liquid at <CAPACITOR>C8192</CAPACITOR>/7 diode red to ground there is .46V.
Charger is taking 20V pulsing .05A
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> =13.1V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>=3.4V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing between 2V-5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing too quickly to read

These seem low but wanted to ask:
L7410/20/30 resistance to ground: 3.1 ohms
L7210/20= 7.7 ohms to ground

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message:
You can compare ohm readings with good board.
Seems to be good values for CPU power rails.

Check diode mode on all other big coils and behind all Power FETs.
Just in case, try to start in SMC bypass.

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message:
Well. damnit I must've messed something up.  All those coils and areas looked good. SMC Bypass didn't work.

I checked solders around <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> and reflowed it. Something smelled like it burned up while putting heat to board. Board showed same symptoms initially and was pulling 20V, with rails pulsing after this but when I went back for second check no longer boosts to 20V intake. NOw stuck at 5v. Makes no sense to me that something burned up. Is there something that would be temp sensitive near <CHIP>U7650</CHIP>? Or <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> burned maybe? Thinking maybe this was the case and not seeing any shorts on PP3V3 G3H or around <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>'s, I replaced <CHIP>U7650</CHIP>. NO change. I hate the newer boards...

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message: Check diode mode to ground at <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> coils.

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message:
L7670 diode mode is .441V
L7690 diode check is .373V

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message: Post <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> voltages; pins 23, 12, 13, 22, 29, 21.

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message:
Those are all 0V.
Maybe what I explained prior was not done well: the board is now only drawing 5V from charger. PPBUS G3H is no longer present, only <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>.

Diode check of <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is .441V

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message: Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> at least?

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message: yes

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message: Check voltage and diode mode at all LDO rails of <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message:
diode values of caps appear to be good at both <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/3200 however i do not have 5V at <CAPACITOR>C3201</CAPACITOR> but <CAPACITOR>C3101</CAPACITOR> =5V. 

Fuses are ok there. 

I swapped out <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> to see if any difference but no change and diode values of caps near <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> still match <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>.

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message:
You cannot get 5V at <CAPACITOR>C3101</CAPACITOR>/201 at same time; depends where the charger is connected.

"Something smelled like it burned up while putting heat to board"
Check what happened then.
Measure diode mode to ground on all caps from that area and closer coils.

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message: Nothing is out of place. Caps, coils  in the area not shorted. Resistors around <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> are good.

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message:
Something happened when you apllied heat on the board for sure; if the problem appeared just after that.
Some BGA chip could be affected by possible accumulated crap.

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message:
I think this is first time i;ve had something random fry just from heat and not be visibly noticeable like a nearby component not meant for heat. Possible maybe the board could hold enough charge if there was an issue somewhere that would then short something out? It definitely smelled like something shorted, yet no power was being supplied to the board while I was reflowing <CHIP>U7650</CHIP>. 

May have to put a fork in this one as I'm just not finding anything out of sorts. So strange that there are no discoverable shorts on the rails and PPBUS G3H seems good, <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> measure legit, yet power draw to 20V is non-existent.

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message: Remove F7000 and check if tries to switch to 20V.

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message: No luck. Sticking at 5V.

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message:
Ended up pulling a board from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with bad LCD and everything works and passes AHT but external display does not work. No corrosion on board, tried resetting smc and PRAM, Clean ME with Medusa. Nothing detected when plugging in external display to it while booting or after boot. Looking in settings nothing shows for external options when connected to external display. 

Seems very unusual for otherwise fully working mac to have no external display with a board only has IG.

Suggestions?

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message:
Bad <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>, or affected by corrosion.
USB 2/3 devices work good?
USB-C redriver chip looks good?

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message:
<CHIP>U2800</CHIP> looks like a fun job to replace. haha...
Yes I was able to load OS from USB 3.0 adapter/USB installer.
I'm sorry, what chip on this board is the USB-C redriver? I tried searching a MPN you mentioned in another thread but it isn't showing in my schematic

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message:
It doesn't appear on available schematic/boardview.
Is the small chip near the metal shield of USB ports (PI3USB...).

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message:
Interestingly when i went to pull chip from the first board in this thread that I smelled something burned... pulling back the plate on <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> of first board revealed a major crack on the surface of the chip. HOw in the hell or why would that burn up when heating area of <CHIP>U7650</CHIP>?? 

So now I believe I need 2 <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>!! are these transferable from other similar boards or must come from 00840?

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message:
It has separated TBT ROM, you may try one from other model board.
However, I cannot confirm it works; always better to use same donor board model.

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message: Swapped the <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> and the TBT redriver chip and still no external display but other uSB functions seem to work. Any other thoughts I can chase down?

threads.title: 00840 Pulsing rails
threads.message:
All the power rails of <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> are good?
There are few very small chips involved.
